snippet: The announcement that 7.1 million people had signed up for plans under the Affordable Care Act came as the Obama administration braced for an escalated political battle ahead of the midterm elections.
abstract: Pres Obama declares victory in the government's aggressive push to enroll seven million people in private health insurance plans under the Affordable Care Act; Obama's senior aides brace for an escalated political battle over the law ahead of crucial midterm elections; milestone may be more significant politically than for its potential impact on the American health system, which remains unclear.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ROBERT PEAR

lead_paragraph: The announcement that 7.1 million people had signed up for plans under the Affordable Care Act came as the Obama administration braced for an escalated political battle ahead of the midterm elections.

headline.main: Obama Claims Victory in Push for Insurance
headline.print_headline: Obama Claims Victory in Push for Insurance

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
